english: ate to fullness; full; finished eating; satiated

etymology.description: 吃饱 + 了 = completed state of being full after eating.
etymology.interpretation: States that one has eaten enough and is now full; 了 marks completion or a new resultant state. In context it can also mean simply "finished eating."
etymology.simplification: 飽 → 饱 by simplifying the food radical 飠 to 饣 to reduce strokes; 吃 and 了 are unchanged. This follows the regular radical simplification pattern in simplified Chinese.

parts.english: eat to fullness; be full; have eaten enough
completed action; change of state; perfective particle; modal particle

examples.chinese: 我吃饱了(我吃飽了)，先休息一下(先休息一下)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ chī bǎo le, xiān xiūxi yíxià.
examples.english: I’m full; I’ll rest a bit first.

examples.chinese: 孩子吃饱了(孩子吃飽了)，就去玩了(就去玩了)。
examples.pinyin: Háizi chī bǎo le, jiù qù wán le.
examples.english: The child ate to fullness and then went to play.

examples.chinese: 我们已经吃饱了(我們已經吃飽了)，不用再点菜了(不用再點菜了)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yǐjīng chī bǎo le, bùyòng zài diǎn cài le.
examples.english: We’ve already eaten our fill; no need to order more dishes.
